DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare bicarbonates versus saline for prevention of contrast induced acute kidney injury in critically ill patients.
DOC.brief_title: Bicarbonates Versus Saline for Contrast Induced Acute Kidney Injury Prevention in Intensive Care Unit
DOC.criteria: patient > 18 years old in intensive care unit since 24h and for up to 48 hours with contrast medium injection patient under renal replacement therapy rise in creatinine > 26Âµmol/L within 48hours anuria within 12 hours cardiogenic pulmonary oedema pH > 7.50 or kaliemia < 3mmol/L pregnancy
